001package imagingbook.calibration.zhang;
002
003import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
004
005import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.util.MathUtil;
006import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Point;
007import imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
008
009
010/** 
011* <p>This class represents a special geometric mapping for
012* rectifying (i.e., removing the lens distortion from)
013* an image, given the associated camera parameters.
014* The transformation maps any position {@code x'} in the rectified image
015* to the corresponding position {@code x} in the original (distorted) 
016* image. The mapping is implicitly inverted, i.e., maps target
017* to source image coordinates.</p>
018* 
019* <p>Typically usage (by target-to-source-mapping):</p>
020* <pre>
021* ImageProcessor original = ... ;  // the distorted image
022* ImageProcessor rectified = ... ; // the (new) rectified image
023* mapping.applyTo(original, rectified, InterpolationMethod.Bicubic);
024* </pre>
025*/
026public class RectificationMapping implements Mapping2D {
027        private final Camera cam;
028        private final RealMatrix Ai;    // inverse of the intrinsic camera matrix (2 x 3)
029
030        public RectificationMapping (Camera cam) {
031//              this.isInverseFlag = true;      // maps target -> source
032                this.cam = cam;
033                this.Ai = cam.getInverseA();
034        }
035
036        @Override
037        public Point applyTo(Point uv) {
038                // (u,v) is an observed sensor point
039                // apply the inverse camera mapping to get the normalized (x,y) point:
040                double[] xy = Ai.operate(MathUtil.toHomogeneous(uv.toArray()));
041                // apply the camera's radial lens distortion in the normalized plane:
042                double[] xyd = cam.warp(xy);
043                // apply the (forward) camera mapping to get the undistorted sensor point (u',v'):
044                return Point.create(cam.mapToSensorPlane(xyd));
045        }
046        
047//      @Override
048//      public double[] applyTo(double x, double y) {
049//              return this.applyTo(new double[] {x, y});
050//      }
051}
